Text saved: An important idea for the Hunger Games book came from old Greek stories. Suzanne loved these stories when she was a child. One of her favourite stories was about a man named Theseus.

In this story, the king of Crete ruled the city of Athens. But the people of Athens fought back. The king was angry. So he gave them a punishment. Every year, Athens had to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete.

They put these young people in a big maze. A monster lived there. The monster's name was the Minotaur. A Minotaur is a monster that eats people. The Minotaur ate the young people.

But one young man was named Theseus. He fought the Minotaur and killed it. Suzanne thinks Katniss Everdeen is like a Theseus from the future.
